On the last #FeaturedFemaleFriday, we're celebrating Raye Jean Jordan Montague, who Good Morning America recognized as a "real-life hidden figure." Ms. Montague revolutionized U.S. Naval ships, and became the first female Program Manager of Ships in the Navy. #WomensHistoryMonth pic.twitter.com/TA0s0qw09I

JUST IN: I introduced three juvenile sentencing reform bills today, because I believe young people that commit crimes can reform their lives without languishing for years in prison. Justice is not a partisan issue.

Lots of conversations about health care lately, but I'm not just talking - I already introduced legislation. My bill, the Fair Care Act, would lower costs, cover preexisting conditions, and increase market competition. @realDonaldTrump reignited the issue, now let's get to work.

Thanks for the shoutout this morning, @RepMarshall! You're right, the Fair Care Act is a great solution to many of the health care issues we're trying to solve. https://twitter.com/NewDay/status/1111251943710552065¬†‚Ä¶

For #FeaturedFemaleFriday, we're celebrating Dorothy Shaver from Mena. Ms. Shaver became president of Lord & Taylor in 1945 with a $110,000 salary, the highest salary for an American woman at the time. 

By 1947, Ms. Shaver was managing a $40 million business. #WomensHistoryMonth pic.twitter.com/Z33Wv1mNk3

Forests are one of our world's most diverse ecosystems, and by education and innovation we can ensure healthy forests exist for generations to come. pic.twitter.com/G9UEXPlnc5

Today's #FeaturedFemaleFriday honors Dr. Mary Good, a brilliant Arkansan chemist. She championed female representation in science, becoming the first woman to chair the National Science Foundation board. Thanks to her, girls were inspired to enter STEM fields. #WomensHistoryMonth pic.twitter.com/mO4q9OUnNW

Did you know that Arkansas leads the nation in poultry production? With more than 2,400 broiler farms, companies that produce and process chicken in Arkansas employ 37,260 people. That's 1 in every 4 agriculture jobs across the state! #ArkansasAgFastFacts #NationalAgWeek
The news of New Zealand's tragedy is heartbreaking. May God be with the victims' families and those still fighting for their lives as a result of this evil act.

Did you know that Arkansas ranks #4 in cotton and cottonseed production? Thanks to modern agricultural developments, farmers are growing almost double the cotton on the same amount of land as they did in 1980. #ArkansasAgFastFacts #NationalAgWeek #NationalAgDay

Did you know that Arkansas is the U.S. birthplace of warm water aquaculture? According to @ArFB, commercial fish farms began raising goldfish in the 1940s, and the industry diversified into producing over 20 species of fish and crustaceans. #ArkansasAgFastFacts #NationalAgWeek

Did you know that Arkansas is the #1 rice-producing state in the country, accounting for half of American rice production? That's why I give out Rice Krispies Treats in my office! #ArkansasAgFastFacts #NationalAgWeek pic.twitter.com/E2rgbwnu7S

Wishing you a happy #NationalAgWeek! Agriculture is the lifeblood of the U.S. and its economy, and I invite you to join me in thanking all the farmers and producers that make our country great. pic.twitter.com/bJQConB71g
